availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Bird P. Brooks (Farmer, 2nd regiment kentucky cav)

body.p: Farmer. Born in 1834 in Kentucky. Married to Elizabeth A. Brooks. Children included Sherwood, Jay W., and Ray W. 1st Lieutenant in Company C in 2nd rRgiment Kentucky Cavalry.

bibl.p: J. H. Battle, W. H. Perrin, & G. C. Kniffin, Kentucky: A History of the State (Louisville: Battey Publishing, 1885), 720; Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Illinois, Macoupin County, Chesterfield, ED 113, sheet 151D, NARA microfilm publication T9 (Washington D.C.: National Archives and Records Administration, n.d.), roll 0232; FHL microfilm 1,254,232.
